Not sure what you mean by “Julia’s behavior is to treat arg1 as Float64.” Like if you don’t specify a type for arg1? In that case arg1 will be whatever type it ends up being when the function is called. But to answer your question:
```f(x::T, arg1) = x - T(arg1)```
Or you can force matched types:
```f(x::T, arg1::T) = x - arg1```
